intro: Swainsona fraseri, commonly known as the Fraser's swainsona, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with long, narrow petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Swainsona fraseri is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
